text.0:
The way your newsroom covers post-election audits can influence public confidence in election results and election security.

Get prepared for the next step in the election process by joining us on 11/10 for this event with @Voting_Works and @aztammyp:
text.1: In these chaotic post-election days, we’ve seen a lot of great journalism that is transparent about its goals and processes while educating the public. Here are examples to be inspired by. If you have any to share, we’d love to see! Tag or email us: info@trustingnews.org. (1/)
text.2: Beware of #misinformation running on social media. Follow these 9 tips from @AmPress (American Press Institute) to make sure you don't share inaccurate information and follow credible news outlets: https://t.co/XnrbGRaKwK https://t.co/6U6bbcTAxI
text.3: Reporters: The Trusted Elections Network at @AmPress is going to talk about audits next week if you want to find out more about how these work and how to cover them. More info on the event here: https://t.co/R5kYkIbUml https://t.co/bScWqUrfQf
text.4: [Factually, Nov. 5] The wait for results in the #Election2020 is rife with opportunity for #misinformation. @CNN's Daniel Dale dazzles with his quick fact-checks of the president. Read and subscribe to our weekly newsletter with the @AmPress :backhand_index_pointing_right:  https://t.co/KUqpvbEEqK https://t.co/CwdTUFzfB5
